9:["$","section",null,{"className":"py-16","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"container mx-auto px-4","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"max-w-3xl mx-auto","children":[["$","h2",null,{"className":"text-3xl font-bold mb-6","children":["About Living in ","Córdoba"]}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground leading-relaxed text-lg","children":"Córdoba is where Argentina's academic tradition meets its tech future. The city's seven major universities create a perpetually young, energetic atmosphere — 200,000+ students keep the nightlife buzzing, the cafe culture thriving, and the cost of living competitive. The tech scene is genuine: Córdoba has attracted major companies (Mercado Libre, Globant) and spawned a vibrant startup ecosystem. The city center is compact and walkable, centered around the historic Manzana Jesuítica (Jesuit Block, UNESCO). What sets Córdoba apart is the sierras — just 30 minutes from the city center, you're in rolling green hills with artisan villages, rivers for swimming, and weekend retreats that feel like another country. The local culture is distinctive: fernet con coca (the unofficial drink), cuarteto music, and a cordobés accent that even porteños struggle with."}]]}]}]}]
